content: in a court case one party was ordered to cover the procedural costs the case involved the division of joint property between two parties the court decided to terminate one partys ownership of immovable property and transfer it to the other party the court also dismissed a claim for additional compensation and ruled on the division of furniture and appliances the court addressed other claims related to loan agreements property rights and lease agreements the case was initiated by one party filing a lawsuit following the dissolution of their marriage the court made its decision based on applicable laws and the circumstances of the case the court determined the division of joint property and the obligations of each party the court also considered the marital property agreement and relevant provisions of family law the court explained that joint property must be determined at the end of a marriage and that the applicable law for dividing joint property is based on the law in force at the time of acquiring the property the court also discussed the progress of a legal case involving apartment ownership and the dispute over the composition of joint property an expert assessment determined the market value of the properties involved the court made decisions regarding compensation for joint property and the division of obligations the court also addressed the ownership of furniture and equipment determining that some items should be considered joint property and others should remain in the sole ownership of one party the court rejected a claim for additional compensation and discussed the division of property rights and obligations arising from a lease agreement the court considered evidence presented by both parties and made its judgment based on the circumstances of the case the court also determined the distribution of procedural costs in the case
